Reviews.Title: “Perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: KoenMAtom
Reviews.Content: ... about 100 meters from the Rialto Bridge, the perfect geographical center of Venice. But, I agree with Fiorentine Mezza; location isn't everything. The hotel is clean but rather out-dated in all aspects. Small rooms with no view, basic breakfast, all services are billed by a friendly staff. Looking for a place to sleep only? You'll enjoy the place.

Reviews.Title: “Location isn't always everything”
Reviews.Author: FiorentinaMezza
Reviews.Content: When we come to Venice, we have a heightened sense of expectation and romance. Sadly this hotel doesn't fit the bill. Our first room was a recently (within days) remodeled closet. We were moved a few floors up (no lift so be careful if you don't love stairs) to a larger space. Rooms are dark and dingy. Bathroom was clean and bright (best feature). The common spaces are just worn out and have not been updated in centuries. Do a little more research and find the spot that fits your imaginings of this amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “good base”
Reviews.Author: Frances B
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. Room was small (double room) but adequate. Its ok for dumping your stuff off and going exploring as its in a good area. Sheets were clean and so was bathroom. Staff were friendly and helpful. Could have done with tea/coffee making facilities in the room though.

Reviews.Title: “It could be better...”
Reviews.Author: Anait88
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is perfect!!! the heart of Venezia - near Rialto bridge! But service in the hotel is awful... stuff is strange, not helpful. when we came we were given a little room on 4 floor, too little, but previously we ordered another type of room, but like explication we were said - SORRY your room is occupied, tomorrow we'll change rooms and you'll move to another one... okay... but we vere surprised but 1st room...it was too much little,... I think 10m2..... and the ceiling appeared WATER in the morning)))))) but the next day we moved to the ordered room and it was really splendid!!! big room with red color design , very beautiful. so only thing that we disliked was STUFF and SERVICE....

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: Christine F
Reviews.Content: The location near the Rialto Bridge was excellent and though the entrance is in an alley - this is not so unusual for Venice. There were signs to get us there. Our room was more like and apartment and I was very impressed to have 4 rooms and a balcony. Only real complaint was the limited hot water. Once you started to feel luke warm water in the shower you had about 30 seconds to get in and out before it would turn back to cold. There was an instant hot dedicated water heater that was not working right. Found the staff English friendly and helpful concerning tourist information.

Reviews.Title: “horror hotel”
Reviews.Author: wonderlustmiss
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 4 nights. whoever said location, location was wrong. location was great- rooms and staff were horrid. both my husband and i got some kind of upper respiratory infection, we suspect from the ventilation system. very old and smelly. i would never go back there.

Reviews.Title: “We would return for its value and location”
Reviews.Author: anastasiaVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel previously in 2008 for our wedding anniversary, and at that time we booked a junior suite room which was situated in the top floor of the building.. This year we were wanting to find a hotel with decent value in San Marco area with no avail and with too much cost. Then we came up with this hotel that we stayed previously. As we knew exactly where it was located (Just off the vapporetto stop "Rialto Bridge" and there is an alley way between the Rialto hotel restaruant and the other buildings) and its services, we booked the hotel right through hotel web page. the money value wise, the hotel was decent- despite the fact that there was no lift and we had to climb up the stairs 3 floors all the times, we loved this hotel. Like others say, the room is specifically small and the shower and washroom is seriously small. However, I think it is well suited for young couples or married couples without kids. If you're travelling with kids or family with 3 persons or more, then this hotel isn't probably nice hotel to say in. But if you're enthusiastic enough to climb up the stairs up and down, and wander the alleys of Venice, then this hotel is definitely a must stay hotel. The vapporetto stop is only few steps away from the hotel, the rialto bridge is only a street across, and small piazza and all the good restaurants and souvernir shops are around the corners of the hotel. Yes, it is behind a big streets, but it is very safe to walk around Venice at night, and it is not dangerous at all. hotel staffs are nice, but didn't bother to ask much as we pretty much knew the area. the hotel TV is extremely small like a monitor screen, but it worked fine in my room. We specifically booked a room without breakfast as we would probably sleep in late, and would have brunches anyways- so we could avoid spending extra money for breakfast. rooms were extremely quiet at night, and airconditioning worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: BK378459
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent had booked this hotel before I read the negative reviews online, but I'm really glad I read them otherwise we may never have found the hotel. One of the reviews provided great step by step directions through the narrow, dark alley to get to the hotel (see photo). The gentlemen at the front desk were always very helpful and friendly, but the condition of the room was dilapidated. The chandelier was hanging oddly from the ceiling (see photo) and we had difficulty with a clogged drain in the EXTREMELY small shower. Small showers were typical of the 2 Italian hotels we stayed at previously, but this one one was definitely the smallest. When I attempted to take a shower, the water started filling up quickly at my feet. We immediately notified the front desk who sent someone to look at it right away. After assessing the situation, he returned with an unmarked bottle of some kind of nasty smelling drain unclogging liquid. The liquid seemed to help somewhat but the shower was slow to drain for the rest of our stay. I ended up standing in a couple inches of water every time I showered. The best thing about this hotel is its proximity to the Rialto Bridge, shops, and marketplaces. The front desk staff was also friendly. The breakfast was mediocre but was consistent with what I had experienced at other Italian hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Location is amazing... need to review service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: ashishkrg
Reviews.Content: we landed up this hotel as we couldn't have rooms anywhere else... so as far as the location was amazing.. just next to Railto Bridge.. but rooms were shady... The reception staff was helpful though but the room lacked basic amenities. I don't think that I would stay there again though... the rooms smelled creepy

Reviews.Title: “Hotel well situated, but wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: ozgirls6181
Reviews.Content: Room was tiny, hot but airconditioning not able to be turned on, windows would not stay open to cool room down. Breakfast was ok, staff member carried suitcases up the stairs and down again when we left, location was good, although in a back alley.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE READ THIS BEFORE YOU STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: ronsims54
Reviews.Content: Good location but that is all The owner is abusive to workers room was filthy dirty and make any prostitute hotel look good. We travel all over the world and this was by far the worst room I have ever stayed in. And I am far from picky. trust me it is bad bad bad Breakfast was not free owner asked for 40 euros for two for packaged garbage!!

Reviews.Title: “Well.....”
Reviews.Author: JanaKrippel
Reviews.Content: Hotel located in the comfy center of everything, Rialto 1 min to go, bus stations, S. Marco, Marco Polo, everything is really close. We had room 32, pretended to be superior with a terrace :D It was the last floor, pretty high to run up and down. I guess in the summer terrible hot! Heating worked some time, some time not... Water was warm but never hot enough for normal shower. Dusty windows and dirty curtains... Breakfast is more or less ok, coffee self service machine and coffee taste was unbelievable terrible! Breakfast room is really without heating, was pretty fresh! Bed was ok, seamed clean :)) We never had dinner in the hotel because of the prices. Read menu before to order, be ready for 12% tax extra and 2.5 (more or less) service charge, but it is possible to find nice restaurant without these kind of charges. Nice wine bars near Rialto Mercato bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: ORFranP86
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel on a budget. It has a wonderful staff, very helpful, considerate, polite, etc. We got a superior room, man it was awesome! It was really huge by any standards, for just a few dollars more. We didn't experience the issues from other reviews as the superior rooms had an elevator. I have absolutely no complaints about this hotel. It is a great bargain and is near the romantic Rialto bridge. You are right on the water bus line, so 10 minutes to any of the other sites, or simply walk it in 20 minutes. Viva La Venizia, can't wait to go back, and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldnt bother staying here again”
Reviews.Author: ZAExplorer
Reviews.Content: Seriously, at 300 Euros a night, dont bother... They rate themselves a 3 star on their official website, We wouldnt give them 1 star. The website says all rooms have : Safe, mini bar, airconditioning. Our room had NO safe, NO mini bar and the airconditioning didnt work. Although the room was clean, it had literally nothing in it. I had to carry our personal belongings with us as there was no safe in the room..Im guessing we stayed in the Standard room, cant really tell. Staff were "short" with you, insisting you leave your room key with them whenever you walk out the front door.Breakfast was a shocker, not sure why they bother serving it, really sub standard compared to the 3 other 3 stars we stayed in on our trip. Have posted a pic of "breakfast" and the room. See for yourself, and try finding ANY photos of the hotel on their website?

Reviews.Title: “Leaky and Foul Smelling”
Reviews.Author: LillianPO
Reviews.Content: Upon returning from a fabulous cruise, my husband, my sister, her boyfriend, and I spent one night at this establishment. We got there early in the morning, and as check in was not until 2:00 pm, we checked our luggage with the front desk and agreed to return later. The staff was quite friendly at this point, taking our eight (!) heavy suitcases upstairs for us so that we would not need to lug them through Venice. However, that is pretty much the only good thing I can say about this hotel. Upon our return at 2:00-ish, we were given our keys and directions to our rooms. We climbed up the stairs to find that our suitcases had been stashed in a hallway. As had toilet paper, wine bottles, and assorted other junk. I suppose with hallways that are so dimly lit (lights are on motion sensors and flicker to life as you approach), the staff assumed no one would notice? We came to our room - number 21 - first. As we opened the door, the room looked small but charming. Cute furniture, wood beamed ceilings, murano glass fixtures. Then the smell hit us. My husband thought it smelled like used cat litter, I thought it was body odor that someone had tried to mask with very strong air freshener. We were both wrong - but more on that later! We turned on the air conditioner and opened the windows, hoping that some air circulation would remedy the stench, and left. Up we went to my sister's room. Hers, number 32, was on the top floor. It was small, but she did have a nice little balcony (off the bathroom), so she was pleased. It was a bit musty up there too, so they opened the windows before we left. We spent a long, lovely afternoon walking around Venice. After much good food and good wine, we decided to turn in for the night, so back we went to the Graspo de Ua. We all went to sleep in our respective rooms, and all had miserable experiences that night! As soon as I turned off the lights, my husband and I heard a loud dripping sound. I turned the lights back on, and lo and behold, the ceiling was leaking. It was not a small leak, mind you, but a steady stream of water pouring from the ceiling onto the bed and floor beside it. The smell got worse! I guess the leak is a regular event in room 21, and the mold/mildew was awakened when it started again! We decided that the wetness and smell were unacceptable, and my husband went downstairs to ask for a new room. He was informed that the hotel was booked solid and that the leak happened all of the time - it was just from the shower above us and it should pass in 15 minutes. Apparently dirty shower water dripping on their guestdoes not phase the staff at Hotel Graspo, and they told my husband to look in the linen closet for new sheets. He found one and some towels. We spent the night on one sheet, under towels. And no discount was offered. My sister's room was not quite so dramatically bad, but it was full of bugs, and both she and her boyfriend were eaten alive all night! Please do not stay in this horrid establishment!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but air conditioning not working for us”
Reviews.Author: BrabDAveB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is newly renovated and the rooms are very nice and the bathrooms very clean and fresh looking. The room had a safe, refrigerator, and TV. However, you have to walk up stairs to get to your room, in our case it was 5 flights of stairs I would not have minded but the air conditioning did not work in our room. We were not shown anything when we went to our room, like how to work the air conditioner or how to call the reception desk. We complained about the air conditioner and someone came up to set it (twice) but it never got cooler only hotter. We moved rooms but the air conditioner (which they set for us) never kept the room cooler than 25C. Maybe that is cool for the Venetians but not for me

Reviews.Title: “Cracking little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: honestchelmsford
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Venice. Cracking little Hotel to see all the sights. I met all the staff and they were polite and helpful. We had a lovely stay, in nice clean warm comfortable rooms. I can understand the yank visitors not liking small rooms, as they have no understanding of the type of properties available in Venice, or ant idea of the culture they are amongst. Anyone visiting Venice will love this little Hotel, with the Rialto bridge and everything nearby. The Aquilina stops outside, so no expensive water taxi's needed. Breakfast was great, rooms clean and serviced. Modern bathrooms en-suite.The rooms do not have great views then neither do 70% of the properties in central Venice. Cross over the bridge and head for the Santos square for the best food at affordable prices. Most of the resturants are expensive in the area, so expect an expensive trip. Loved Venice, just loved it.

Reviews.Title: “venice holiday”
Reviews.Author: MileBabic
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, clean room, a few steps from Rialto Bridge. Peaceful and beautiful, near Piazza San Marco. staff very friendly and helpful, very comfortable rooms with nice clean bathroom. Service and good breakfast .... the ideal place for a romantic holiday of love. Excellent restaurant, typical Venetian .... We certenly come again and recommend ...... Mile and Masha

Reviews.Title: “romantic holiday in venice”
Reviews.Author: snjezanabih
Reviews.Content: Hotel is much much romantic...... we raccomend...... Twenty meters from RialtosBride.... Room was clean, very good service and people. Room was clean, big with good bathroom. Brekfast was very good. We had a very good diner in hotel*s restaurant, we recomend restaurant too..... (good food, wine and price)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - clean, tidy hotel”
Reviews.Author: sianelaine
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews below, I'm surprised we experienced the same hotel! Like some other travellers, we were transferred here two days before our holiday due to an overbooking at our original hotel. We were placed in superior room 3 - very nicely decorated, looked to be recently refurbished. Although the room was decorated in dark colours, it was very nice. Some other travellers have commented on how dark the rooms were. This is a common observation of my time in Venice, but most hotels (apart from the expensive ones on the grand canal) are down alley ways. Please bear in mind that most of the buildings are 4 or 5 stories high so you probably won't get a view, or lots of light! One of the consequences of staying in Venice I believe!!! Breakfast was filling - juice, coffees, rolls etc - standard continental. My only complaint about the whole hotel is that our room was opposite the breakfast room so we could hear staff clattering around from about 7am. We didn't bother asking to change our room - we were on a sightseeing holiday so were up most days by 8 anyway! Found staff to be very helpful, especially when the lock on my suitcase jammed and they helped me to cut it off with boltcutters. Probably wouldn't return to Venice as two days was enough but would be happy to stay in this hotel for a city break again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst 2 days of our lives -AVOID IT!”
Reviews.Author: cmcg25
Reviews.Content: We initially booked to stay for 4 days in a lovely hotel in Cannaregio (Al Regio Canal) but unfortunately we were transferred to this dump due to refurbishments. In order to reach the hotel, we had to pass through a damp, dark and extremely narrow alleyway which stank terribly. We were shocked at the state of the hotel on arrival. We were allocated a room and desperately hoped that the condition of our room would compensate for our first impressions but we were disapointed even further when we were sent to the very top of the building (having to carry our own luggage up several flights of stairs) only to find that the room was gloomy and stank of damp carpet due to a leeking roof. We were moved into the adjoining, extremely small, room suitable only for a single person wanting to sleep on two single beds joined together. Breakfast was too expensive at 10 Euro per person and the view from the window was gruesome. All we could see when opening the window was pigeons and their faeces. There was no safe in the room or power sockets to charge our phones or camera and to add insult to injury when we asked for an iron we were told that it was against fire regulations to have an iron in the building. Our sheets were not changed throughout our stay and we only had the glory hot water on one occassion. The bathroom was tiny and there were cracks on the walls near the shower cubicle. Cleanliness was not a priority in this hotel. The location in breathtaking but beware that most mornings the streets are flooded so be prepared and have wellington boots at the ready if you chose to stay here. In summary, avoid this hotel at all costs if you want an enjoyable experience of Venice. The city is beautiful and there are plenty of beautiful hotels far superior to this in the same beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable base from which to see Venice.”
Reviews.Author: O.G.C.
Reviews.Content: Having booked the Graspo de Ua before reading the personal reviews, I was very glad I did read them because it meant that I was pleasantly surprised. My daughter and I arrived late at night and had been given a Superior room on the fifth floor (no lift): we did have to carry the luggage ourselves, but on our departure, when there were more staff members, it was carried for us. Yes, the room was small, but it was clean and had comfortable beds. It was decorated with good quality fabric on the walls and painted furniture giving one a flavour of old Venice. Also the view across the red tiled rooftops was typically Venetian, and the shuttered window. The bathroom was modern, a clean white suite and tiles, white towels, and had a good shower. The air conditioning was efficient though not silent. The room and bathroom were cleaned daily and towels replaced. We chose not to have breakfast at â‚¬10 but there was an unstocked fridge in which we were able to put yoghurts and fruit. I have stayed in pleasant, predictable, spacious, modern hotel rooms but this place somehow was quite appropriate to the unique experience of Venice. It was wonderful, that first day, to walk out of the door and have coffee right by the Rialto Bridge â€“ even if it did cost â‚¬4.50 each! If you are romantics, obviously you might like to sit on a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal â€“ but it will cost you much more than the Graspo de Ua.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Hotel...Avoid it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fashionable
Reviews.Content: The room, "a suite junior", was very very small and very expensive, also it was dirty and old, and the staff was very unfriendly and bad-mannered. All the rooms are in the hightest floors and it hasn`t elevator and it has steep and narrow stairs, and. Also I stayed 7 days in this hotel and nobody cleaned my room (the same sheets and towels during 7 days)...incredible...AVOID IT!!!! ...you won`t like it......there are much better cheaper and cleaner hotels in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tourist099
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Graspo de Ua for three nights in July 2008. The rooms are small and the hotel is very small. There is no view from the windows. The breakfast room feels like an underground bunker. All of that is tolerable, but what makes us recommend that you avoid this hotel is the staff. The staff is quite unhelpful in general. The worst thing is that Gianni, the manager, is rude, arrogant, and ill-mannered; and you should watch out for your money when you make deals with him. For example, we asked him to book a taxi to the airport and he quoted us a "minimum" price that turned out to be 40% higher than what we got when we went to the Canal Grande and booked the taxi ourselves! He then tried to refuse to cancel the taxi reservation that he had made at a 40% higher cost! Similarly, he booked a tour of Venice for us at a cost higher than what we would have found ourselves at the office in Piazza San Marco. And he did not accept credit cards, only cash! So, if you are concerned about not being ripped off, do not stay at Graspo de Ua!

Reviews.Title: “Positively surprised!”
Reviews.Author: nikitaa
Reviews.Content: I have to say, after reading the reviews, I was a bit worried and tried not to expect too much - but I was positively surprised and definitely recommend it! The receptionists were nice and helped us whenever we had a question about Venice and transport. It's true that there is no elevator but when we arrived, a servant came and offered to carry our luggage. I even got upgraded to the superior room without asking! About the hotel room: The bed was spacious, there was even another cozy blanket in the wardrobe. We had a bath and two lavatories for man and woman. It was very clean though there was one thing I didn't like: There was no shower curtain! This should be definitely fixed because after a shower, the floor was really wet. The breakfast was really good and there was a lot of food! The location of the hotel is also very good, no complaints about the staff. I think they are really renovating the hotel because sometimes I saw workers and painters in front of the restaurant (which is a good thing). I totally recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Last Minuate”
Reviews.Author: Schmooles
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel the same day we arrived in Venice. This hotel has two parts. Some of the rooms are within the same building as the front reception and there are others adjacent to this down a slightly scary narrow street with a gate that you must get buzzed in through. The room we stayed in was next to one other room that was part of the hotel and a private residence. The room was spacious and the air conditioning worked great! The shower was extremely small but did it's job. The breakfast each morning was filling. The staff was friendly. The hotel was also very close to the rialto bridge.

Reviews.Title: “A proper Venetian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kate C
Reviews.Content: Came here for a nice, romantic, weekend summer break in 2005. The hotel was hidden down a very narrow street, exactly what I wanted and expected from Venice! We arrived very late at night and it was so surreal and fun walking through all these little streets in the dark, but we found it with no problem. The hotel was clean and decor was fine, I always like a bit of kitsch decor myself anyway. Was happy to see a modern bathroom, although the shower left a lot to be desired. I guess Iâ€™m just used to a power shower. Breakfast was in the tiniest room ever - very intimate - but I guess this added to the charm, and consisted of your usual continental selection. The staff were quite amusing because they didn't speak much English but it didn't matter, we communicated fine. We also had an amusing incident whist walking down the hotel stairs one afternoon there was a very nosy couple 'at it' in their room - so bear in mind the thinness of the walls/doors!!! Location-wise as other people have also noted it's extremely central, however if you are considering taking a trip to Venice I would go out of the summer season as it is just heaving with tourists and a lot of the restaurants charge 10 Euros just sit at the table before even buying any food! Would defiantly come back to this hotel and recommend - but would come at a different time of year next time.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely lovely - what a nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: KMShook
Reviews.Content: Our two-night stay at the Graspo da Ua was part of a (super-cheap!) EasyJet holiday. The low price of the package, and some damning reviews on TripAdvisor, meant our expectations were correspondingly low, although to be honest we've travelled a fair bit and don't faint away if an inexpensive three-star hotel in an old European city has modest-sized rooms, a lobby smaller than a football pitch, no lift (oh, those inconsiderate builders a few hundred years back!) or the nearby streets are, you know, narrow and old-looking. Ahem. All things considered, then, we turned up hoping it didn't smell bad and that our bed had sheets on it. So what a lovely surprise! We got several times our money's worth. All three front-desk clerks we met were nice, ranging from solemnly polite to smiley and considerate... above and beyond thoughtful actually; when we returned on our last evening to pick up the bags we'd left in their care (2 euros for the day), the afternoon clerk asked whether we'd like to use the washroom before we went. All were very patient with my less-than-perfect Italian and perfectly helpful when we turned up before check-in time on the first day. They're renovating at the moment, but our lovely room (18) was clearly recently redone. It has wooden beams on the ceiling, its own lovely little balcony (shame we were there in January!), a small but spotlessly clean and modern bathroom (heated towel rail, new towels and all) and a minibar with low priced drinks. Yes, it helps if you like standard 18th-century-style Venetian hotel decor, but it was lovely for what it was. And yes, it was a small room - as you would expect in this city (or NYC or London for that matter). But we weren't at the Marriott nor did we expect it to be. As has been noted, the location couldn't be closer to the action - it's surreally central, just a few metres from the Rialto, tucked down an atmospheric alleyway, almost being like backstage at the brilliant theatre that is Venice. Yes, it took a few minutes to find, since I'd forgotten to print out their map, but it is marked with a sign on the pavement on both ends of the alleyway, and if you want a city with no navigational hiccups you won't be in Venice anyway. The ongoing renovations didn't bother us - on our last day, we came down a few flights of stairs to see practically the entire second floor reduced to a building site, but we hadn't heard a thing before 9am, and the morning clerk seemed honestly concerned that we hadn't been inconvenienced. Which we weren't. We didn't eat breakfast there, since it's always more fun to go out and find your own, especially in the Rialto... so I can't say whether they're still (gasp) trying to serve tinned fruit salad, but we overheard some other folks from the UK on our first morning there saying that the breakfast was nice and generous. Considering that as we were there as part of a package and thus the hotel was making very little money from our stay (other than filling a room they might otherwise not have filled in a very quiet week before Carnival) we never for an instant ever felt like anything other than regulars they were rather fond of . When we left saying we hoped we could afford to come back when we didn't get a super-cheap package deal, the smiley afternoon clerk said they were happy to have us regardless of what we had paid, and that if we did want to come back, we should be sure to mention that we had stayed there before and we'd be offered a discount. It's a tourist city, folks, and you can understand why tourist facilities in such places are overpriced and underwhelming, and why the people working with the public, especially in hotels, get indifferent or even snarly. I feel honour bound to note once again that this hotel was a real little gem and the folks were charming. Of course, it also depends on the attitude you bring to it. KS

Reviews.Title: “Find something better”
Reviews.Author: haighs_speckles
Reviews.Content: The Graspo de Ua is in a good location, near the Rialto Bridge with canal front eateries and ACTV stops. It is tucked down a narrow back-alley, making it a little hard to find at first - and don't ask the woman at the gelati store on the canal front for directions! The hotel itself leaves a lot to desire. There is a tiny little lobby leading directly to a set of stairs.. and more stairs.. and more stairs. We lucked out and got a room on the top (5th) floor and so spent the 5 days getting fit climbing up and down several times a day. The manager (or owner?) didn't seem very friendly and not that nice to his staff. We felt sorry for the young Indian guy who lugged heavy cases up and down the stairs all day for guests - we tipped him personally 5 euro each on the day we left. The room is on the small side, but okay. However, the beds were hard as rocks and were skinny singles - the type where you almost fall out when turning over at night. The upside to the bathroom was that it had an electric exhaust fan to take away the steam (we only encountered two of these on a 6 week holiday throughout Europe & UK). The downsides were that the bathroom was small and the shower tiny. The water constently changed from too hot to too cold and the shower was so small that you had to wedge yourself into the corner of the cold glass to avoid being burnt or frozen from the water. I can't remember how many times I elbowed the glass due to the confinement. The breakfast was awful and the cleanliness just so, so. Overall, it was bearable, but I'd suggest paying extra and getting something better.

Reviews.Title: “Stones throw from Rialto Bridge but you could get better for your money”
Reviews.Author: janejsb
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this Hotel is the position, just a stone's throw from the Rialto Bridge. Our room was very clean but small, the bathroom well you would have a job "swinging a cat" in it. Could do with a bit of updating but like I always think it is somewhere to sleep, I didn't go to Venice to admire the room. I am sure we could have got better for our money but what the heck we had a great time and that's what counts.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not a 3 star...”
Reviews.Author: Jaayman
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Graspo de Ua Hotel and were not impressed at all. The room was small and stifling. There were stains on the carpet and in general it needed a good cleaning. We had requested two single or two double beds and ended up with only one double. The hotel management did not have any otions for us when approached about this problem. The saving grace was a small balcony with a roof top view and a direct line of sight to the bell tower at St. Marks. This area with chairs and a table proved to be an oasis and the only spot in the hotel to sit and write or read, other than on your bed. The small reception and narrow staircase with stained worn carpet did little to improve the appearance of what was claimed to be a partially renovated hotel. The climb to the 5th floor (no elevator) was uncomfortable in the heat. The staff while polite were otherwise indifferent. The breakfast area and offerings were poor with limited selections including lukewarm yoghurt and coffee. The breakfast room was small and did not appear to offer any air conditioning. A three star hotel this is not. Other than the balcony, the only positive point is its central location with easy access to transportation and streets.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: LordTregaron
Reviews.Content: Very poor indeed. Ruined my time in Venice. Room very small, damp and smelly. Unable to be moved to another room. Nowhere to sit and relax so one has to be either in the shabby room or out. No tea or coffee making facilities in the room and worst of all was the noise. Room One is directly above the front door and reception (with a night porter that snored loudly all of my first night. Sleep was fitfull because of the regular banging of the front door and ringing of the night bell, until 1 or 2 in the morning. I was woken every morning at about 4am by talking etc. So I had very little sleep even with the sleeping tablets I had resorted to. The hotel website advertises it as being decorated in the 18th century Venitian style but that is a complete joke. The website photos must've been taken when the hotel was first decorated because all of the areas I saw were tired, slightly dirty and definately worse for wear. This is NOT a three star hotel. It is a rather shabby guesthouse in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “somewhere to sleep”
Reviews.Author: dressagediva
Reviews.Content: we stayed for three nights and have to say that if all you want is somewhere to lay your head at night it was fine but thats as far as it goes!! My fiance will eat anything but we found the breakfast inedible and had to go and get a coffee and pastry from around the corner. The room was tiny but clean enough. We arrived at night and would not have found the hotel had we not met someone also staying there, her single room (for which she paid extra) was more like a broom cupboard and my fiance had to help her up the three flights of stairs with her bags as the receptionist didnt seen to think that was in his job description. In short, Venice is a wonderfull city but this hotel spoilt it for us!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but typical”
Reviews.Author: ItalianNewcomer
Reviews.Content: A small hotel with small but comfortable rooms, well located. Breakfast was a poor affair but at least it filled a corner until lunch. This is a typical Venice hotel, well situated but expensive for the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but typical.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel before reading reveiws, we travelled with trepidation, but our fears were really groundless. You have to except that Venice is falling apart and apart from the very top hotels, all the others are old and crumbling. Ok this place is small and the wall paper is coming off in places, but the rooms are clean and functional, the staff very helpful, and the Buffet breakfast excellant. The hotel is located literally 50yds from the Rialto Bridge ( albeit in a side street) equal distance from the boat terminal. Nothing in Venice is cheap, so if you can get this place for around Â£110 per night you have not done bad.

Reviews.Title: “Do Your Research”
Reviews.Author: dr.ms
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Graspo in mid-August, 2005. Although the hotel is conveniently located in Venice, we should have done more research for a better quality hotel. We kept ourselves very busy and spent little time in our very small room. We both found the hotel management to be very curt and unfriendly. Once we inquired about attending an opera and wanted to purchase tickets. The attendant at the front desk was rude and dismissive. We didn't rely on the front desk for any further help. Keep your drapes closed! One late afternoon we opened our drapes to get in some natural light in the dark room and to our surprise saw a naked man in the opposite room facing ours!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice at the end of January. If you are looking for a cheap hotel then Graspo De Ua Hotel is the place to stay. It is ideally situated near the Rialto Bridge, St Marks Square and other 'must see' sights. It is very easy to find, providing you've got the map from their website. When you step off the water bus, the hotel is one minute's walk from there. Graspo De Ua Hotel is not 'The Ritz' but then we were not there to sit in the hotel all day! Graspo De Ua Hotel supplies clean bedding, fresh towels daily and a decent breakfast, what more could you want! The staff at the Graspo De Ua Hotel were friendly and helpful and we thoroughly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We turned up at De Graspo De Ua at about 10:30pm at night only to walk into the tiniest lobby ever where another couple was complaining about something (not sure what) and demanding their money back! Not a good start!! We felt uneasy about the place immediately but still checked in and went to our rooms. We had to walk up 3 flights of steps with huge suitcases with no one to help us (no lifts either!) The room was tiny but we were willing to live with this as we had been told that was the norm in Venice. The room was "quaint" but old, and I read in another review that they claimed to have recently renovated - and we agree that cannot be true! The bathroom was ok, very tiny and my partner (who is not a huge man, probably thinner then average) found that the shower was so small that when he turned around he would bump the tap off. My mother was in a different room by herself and her bathroom was actully bigger, but the shower head was situated in the bath so she had to sit down to have a shower! On the second morning (the day we checked out) my partner had a shower and came out about a minute later and told me to hurry up and get in as he had the shower on full and only a trickle was coming out. It stopped completely before I could get out of the bed. The breakfast was terrible, we ate out the second day. There was something wrong with the milk and I was unable to eat my cereal or drink my luke warm coffee. I didn't have a problem with the serving lady like others have had though. The staff were not that helpful and we had to purchase a map of the city. We extended out stay in Venice from 2 nights to 4 nights and when we asked about whether they could accomodate us they quoted us $150 Euros for a triple room. We actually went to The Rialto who welcomed us in their beautifully large and professional reception and were able to offer us 2 rooms at $90 Euros each and whilst that is more then the triple room, we needed our space!!! When we checked in the Rialto the concierge gave us a map and showed us great places to go and recomended where to take Gondella rides etc. The also had lifts for the first two floors! I have written a review of the Rialto and would highly reccomend it to anyone who is staying in Venice - dont stay at Graspo De Ua

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As very regular visitors to Venice we chose this hotel as the website shows it to be a 3 star hotel with good facilities. How wrong can it be! This hotel certainly does not rate 3 stars, it certainly hasn't been renovated in 2003/5 as the website suggests, the carpets in the main halls and stairs are threadbare and dirty. Mould was evident in the bathroom, some tiles and the bidet are cracked. Wallpaper was peeling off. And to top it all the heating didn't work for the time we were there when the temperature outside was below freezing. Our complaints were not taken seriously in anyway by the management, the only person to try and help was the night guy who did his best but couldn't get anywhere because his calls to his director were ignored. A hotel to be avoided.

HotelInfo.Name: Graspo de Ua
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 5094 | Calle dei Bombasieri, 30124 Venice, Italy
